page.title: 01The Millport Town Area
page.content: Millport is the only town on the Isle of Cumbrae in the Firth of Clyde. 10 1/2 miles in circumference. Population around 1200. In the summer season it can rise to 15000. Holiday makers come mainly from nearby cities. The marine biological station is owned by Glasgow and London universitys for studying marine life. The cathedral of the isles is the smallest in Britain. Millport old pier and bay are a haven for small craft. Locals work on farms, hav small shops, are tradesmen, or work on the mainland. Household appliances are mainl electric (no gas). The island boasts an 18 hole golf course, 3 putting greens, 3 tennis courst and a bowling green. On the shore road there is a lion (shaped) rock and a crocodile (shaped) rock. There is a cottage hospital with 16 beds and xray facilities.
